location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lewis Pelly, Bushire to Messrs Remington and Company

physicalDescription.extent: The letter book has been turned upside down and the correspondence relating to banking and financial matters has been entered from back to front, therefore the correspondence itself is upside down in relation to the folio numbers.

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing a treasury note for 1500 rupees to be credited to his account and informing them that there are roughly 1700 rupees in his account in the old bank which can also be realised.The letter also requests that they realize any dividends paid on his British Colaba Land Reclamation shares and that they forward a package they have received for him to Bushire as soon as possible.
